title: Senior Javautvecklare inom Digital Kundupplevelse
description:
Vill du bygga smarta API:er och moderna backend-tjänster som gör verklig skillnad för miljontals kunder? Nu har du chansen att vara med och forma nästa generations digitala kundupplevelse på Folksam.



Vi är mitt i en spännande transformation där vi lämnar gamla system bakom oss och bygger upp något nytt: en plattform baserad på moderna, återanvändbara komponenter, affärsflöden och API:er.



Hos oss får du vara med och bygga upp en modern mikrotjänstarkitektur – där REST API:er, mikrotjänster och eventdriven kommunikation samverkar på OpenShift. Du får vara med från grunden och påverka tekniska beslut som faktiskt betyder något – både för vår arkitektur och för våra kunder.



IT enheten på Folksam består av ca 750 medarbetare fördelat på nio sektioner. Vi arbetar enligt agila arbetssätt med fokus på digitalisering. Inom sektionen Digital Kundupplevelse är vi runt 120 medarbetare som ansvarar för både backend och frontend för våra digitala kanaler. Du kommer jobba tajt i team tillsammans med andra systemutvecklare.


**Det här gör du som systemutvecklare på Digital Kundupplevelse**
-----------------------------------------------------------------



Som utvecklare hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla och konsolidera våra backend-tjänster och applikationer för att öka återanvändbarheten och förbättra kundupplevelsen samt bygga upp vår digitala plattform. Hos oss befinner du dig mitt i ett snabbt växande digitalt landskap där vi utvecklar självbetjäningstjänster och möter våra kunder professionellt och personligt via olika digitala och innovativa alternativ. Det du utvecklar kommer vara oerhört viktigt och synligt för alla våra miljoner kunder - här kan just du göra skillnad!



Som systemutvecklare hos oss är du med och:


* Bygger moderna lösningar i Java Spring Boot .
* Utvecklar robusta REST API:er .
* Utvärderar och sätter upp eventdrivna integrationer med Kafka.
* Säkerställer hög kvalitet genom CI/CD och automatiserade flöden.
* Driftsätter och skalar lösningar på OpenShift.

**Är du den vi söker?**
-----------------------



Som erfaren systemutvecklare är du med och leder teamet genom vår digitala transformation och de tekniska lösningar som behövs för att nå dit.



Du har jobbat med java-utveckling i minst sju år och känner dig hemma i ett modernt DevOps-tänk där kvalitet, leverans och innovation går hand i hand. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.



Du har en nyfiken inställning till både teknik och människor och gillar att utforska nya lösningar och utmana gamla sanningar. Du bidrar till en öppen och prestigelös kultur där man vågar fråga, dela med sig och fira framsteg – och lära sig av sina misstag. Du tror på teamets kraft, men tar också ansvar för din egen utveckling och leverans.


**Här kan du göra skillnad**
----------------------------



Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.  

  

Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.



Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar


**Så söker du jobbet**
----------------------



Välkommen med din ansökan senast 7 november. I denna rekrytering kommer vi inte efterfråga ett personligt brev. Du som kandidat kommer få svara på ett antal frågor som fokuserar på de erfarenheter och kompetenser som är viktiga i just detta jobb. I samband med din ansökan ber vi dig därför bifoga ditt CV och besvara frågorna. Vid första urval kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån denna information.



Om du har frågor om jobbet eller Digital Kundupplevelses organisation är du välkommen att kontakta någon av oss avdelningschefer: Daniel Tyseng 072-468 72 04, Maria Werin Enblom 076-864 02 51, Johannes Odgren 072-468 70 28.



Fackliga kontaktpersoner: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson 073- 423 59 12 och Handels Mikael Carlsson 070-831 51 32.


*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Product & Digital Business Developer, P&UW Vehicle Sweden, BA Commercial
description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of vehicle insurance and driving digital innovation? We are looking for a Product & Digital Business Developer to join our team in Sweden. In this role, you will contribute to the development of our vehicle insurance offering and lead the digital business development agenda across the Nordic region.
About If
If is the leading insurance company in the Nordics and Baltics, with 7,900 dedicated professionals. More than just an insurer, we are protectors, enablers, and supporters of dreams. With our combined expertise and commitment, we stand by our customers—giving them the confidence to explore, grow, and live fully.
Business Area Commercial serves B2B customers of all sizes—from startups to established enterprises. Vehicle insurance is a key component of many customers’ insurance needs across the Nordics. Within Product & Underwriting Vehicle Sweden, we are on an ambitious growth journey, particularly in the SME segment. To support this, we are exploring digital sales opportunities, service-based insurance models, and innovative pricing strategies.
About the Role
As Product & Digital Business Developer, you will:* Develop product content, terms and conditions and pricing in collaboration with the team and key stakeholders
* Lead and participate in product development initiatives, including packaging improvements, bundling experiments, and partner offering support
* Maintain and evolve our insurance terms and conditions
* Support internal stakeholders in interpreting terms and designing insurance solutions
* Drive the digital product development agenda, including experimentation, development, and implementation of digital offerings and pricing from a Nordic perspective
* Govern and lead the digital agenda for Vehicle across the Nordics in close collaboration with agile teams (tribes)


Key Responsibilities
You will be a central part of the analyst team within P&UW Vehicle, with responsibilities including:* Rethinking and developing our vehicle insurance products, content, and terms
* Building deep expertise in product structure and conditions, and sharing knowledge across sales, claims, and within the Vehicle team
* Owning and driving the digital product agenda, ensuring successful implementation and stakeholder alignment


What You Can Expect from Us* Opportunities to grow through diverse and strategic projects
* Autonomy and responsibility in your work
* A supportive team and leadership
* A culture that values shared success and continuous learning


Who You Are
Success in this role can come from various backgrounds, but you’re likely to thrive if you:* Have experience in project work and can drive initiatives independently and collaboratively
* Are solution-oriented and eager to improve processes
* Are structured and able to manage both details and strategic perspectives
* Have knowledge of vehicle insurance (a clear advantage)
* Willingness to run and pursue insurance product development in our insurance systems (Polaris and WayPoint)
* Curiosity in exploring technical aspects of our insurance systems and connection to digital sales
* Are fluent in Swedish and English, and able to communicate clearly on complex topics
* Can work effectively in a Nordic context
* Hold a relevant university degree


Practical Information
Application: Apply by submitting your CV and a short personal letter
Location: Bergshamra, Solna. Some travel within Sweden and the Nordics may be required
Employment Type: Full-time
Application Deadline: 2nd of November
Contact: Recruiting manager is Charlotte von Plomgren Head of Product & Underwriting Vehicle Sweden. However, Main contact person during interviews will be Henric Johnler, Interim Head of Product & Underwriting Vehicle Sweden (during Charlotte’s parental leave 20th of October 2025 – 1st of September 2026). Contact information:
Henric.johnler@if.se

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Standardize & Scale: Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* Tackle Tech Debt: Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* Create Real Value: Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* Lead & Collaborate: Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Language Expertise: At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* Adaptability: An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* Product Mindset: Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* Problem-Solver: A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.


 Bonus Skills
   

  

* B2B & B2C Background: Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* Scaling Know-How: Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* Payments Experience: A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.


 Why Work with Us?
   

  

 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
   

  

 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
   

  

 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
   

  

 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: AI & Full Stack Developer Intern
description:
**Position:** 
 AI & Full Stack Developer Intern
 



**Location:** 
 Remote
 



**Type:** 
 Unpaid Internship
 



**Start Date:** 
 Immediate
 



**Duration** 
 : 3-6 months (Flexible, Part-Time or Full-Time)
 



  





**Overview:** 




 Are you a Tech enthusiast with a passion for both front-end magic and back-end wizardry? We're on the lookout for innovative Full Stack Developers to join our dynamic team and help us build cutting-edge solutions. If you’re ready to shape the future of digital experiences, this is the opportunity for you!
 



 We are currently in the very early stages of developing our beta version and are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team and help bring our vision to life.
 



  





**Your Role:** 




 As a Full stack Developer Intern at Gaddr, you will have the unique opportunity to contribute to the development of our platform from the ground up. This role is perfect for someone eager to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced startup environment and to work on a variety of challenging and innovative projects.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 




  





 ·        
 **Backend Development:** 
 Work on building and optimizing the platform’s backend infrastructure, ensuring it is scalable and robust.
 



 ·        
 **Frontend Development:** 
 Design and implement user-friendly interfaces using cutting-edge technologies to create a seamless user experience across web and mobile platforms.
 



 ·        
 **Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with our design, product, and marketing teams to align the technical aspects of our platform with our overall vision.
 



 ·        
 **AI Integration:** 
 Collaborate on integrating AI features into our platform to enhance user interaction and automate processes.
 



 ·        
 **Cloud Hosting & Microservices:** 
 Gain hands-on experience in cloud hosting, deploying microservices, and managing scalable infrastructure.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 ·        Proficiency in both frontend and backend development (Rust is an extra plus).
 



 ·        Experience with frameworks such as React, Next.js, Node.js, or similar.
 



 ·        Understanding of cloud computing and microservices architecture.
 



 ·        A passion for learning new technologies and applying them in creative ways.
 



 ·        Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
 



  





**Why Join Gaddr ?** 




**Innovative Environment:** 
 Be part of a startup that’s pushing the boundaries of technology and digital experiences.
 



**Real Impact:** 
 Your contributions will directly influence the development and success of our platform.
 



**Learning Opportunity** 
 : Gain invaluable hands-on experience in full stack development, AI integration, and more.
 



  





**Next Steps :** 




 If you're excited about the opportunity to work with a forward-thinking startup and help shape the future of digital experiences, we’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you’re interested in the role and what you hope to achieve during your internship.
 



  





***Note: This is an unpaid internship. We are in the early stages of our startup and cannot offer financial compensation at this time. However, the experience and skills you gain, if done right, should be valuable for your career development.***




  





 Join us on this exciting journey, and let’s create something amazing together!

title: Senior Game Designer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The Role – Senior Game Designer**
 We’re looking for a Senior Game Designer to join the QuizDuel team. We are seeking someone who enjoys crafting fun, engaging experiences, bringing fresh ideas to life, and helping shape the future of one of our most popular live titles.
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone who loves collaborating with others, exploring creative solutions, and making thoughtful design decisions by combining creativity, data and player insights. You’ll work closely with a talented, supportive, and cross-functional team where your ideas will make a real impact.
   

  

 Check out QuizDuel here: https://www.maginteractive.com/games/quizduel/
   

  

 Although this role is to work with the QuizDuel team, you may work in other teams here at MAG in the future.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design and deliver innovative features, mechanics, and content that delight and engage our players.
* Manage the full design process, from concept and prototyping to implementation and iteration.
* Develop a deep understanding of QuizDuel’s modes, events, and systems… and yes, you’ll play it a lot!
* Collaborate closely with the product lead, developers, artists, and the data analyst in the team to bring your designs to life.
* Use player insights and analytics to refine features and enhance the player experience. Don't worry there’s no need to crunch numbers, but you’ll understand what they mean.
* Keep up to date with F2P market trends and competitor games to inspire creative innovation.
* Deconstruct successful F2P game systems to inform and strengthen your design strategies.
* Share your ideas clearly and confidently, ensuring everyone understands the why behind your ideas.
* Regularly seek feedback and collaborate with wider teams at MAG to ensure you are making use of the knowledge we have internally.


**Your Skills & Experience**
* 5+ years of experience in game design, ideally in F2P casual mobile games.
* Experience working on live games with high DAU, balancing player enjoyment, innovation, and business goals.
* Strong understanding of F2P fundamentals such as; engagement loops, progression, monetization, and balancing.
* Comfortable interpreting key metrics (e.g. retention, ARPDAU, conversion, churn) to identify opportunities for improving features.
* Familiarity with analytics dashboards and the ability to apply insights effectively.
* A proven track record of designing and iterating on features that enhance player experience.
* Excellent communication skills so you are able to share your vision clearly and listen openly to feedback.
* Curious, and driven, you will be given a lot of trust to seek out new ideas and make an impact on a key game here at MAG.
* Fluent in English (written and verbal).


**Nice to Have**
* Unity experience to prototype and test ideas independently.
* Knowledge of level design, balancing, and progression systems.


**Perks And Benefits**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives
* Free weekly beginner Swedish lessons (if you want to learn the language)!


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
   

  

 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
   

  

 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.

title: Product & Digital Business Developer, P&UW Vehicle Sweden, BA Commercial
description:

* Owning and driving the digital product agenda, ensuring successful implementation and stakeholder alignment


 What You Can Expect from Us

* Autonomy and responsibility in your work

* A culture that values shared success and continuous learning

 Success in this role can come from various backgrounds, but you’re likely to thrive if you:

* Are solution-oriented and eager to improve processes
* Are structured and able to manage both details and strategic perspectives
* Have knowledge of vehicle insurance (a clear advantage)

* Curiosity in exploring technical aspects of our insurance systems and connection to digital sales
* Are fluent in Swedish and English, and able to communicate clearly on complex topics
* Can work effectively in a Nordic context
* Hold a relevant university degree


 Practical Information
   

  

**Application:** 
 Apply by submitting your CV and a short personal letter
   

  

**Location:** 
 Bergshamra, Solna. Some travel within Sweden and the Nordics may be required
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 2nd of November
   

  

**Contact:** 
 Recruiting manager is Charlotte von Plomgren Head of Product & Underwriting Vehicle Sweden. However, Main contact person during interviews will be Henric Johnler, Interim Head of Product & Underwriting Vehicle Sweden (during Charlotte’s parental leave 20th of October 2025 – 1st of September 2026). Contact information:
   

  

 Henric.johnler@if.se
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Testingenjör inbyggda system
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ge dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 På Getinge Critical Care i Solna utvecklas och tillverkas ventilatorer och anestesimaskiner till sjukvården. Vi söker nu en testare till ett av våra R&D team inom anestesi.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av 8 personer och ansvarar för Core SW, systemarkitektur, cyber security samt connectivity i våra anestesimaskiner. Din roll i detta team och inom anestesi är att testa Core SW tillsammans med lågnivå SW för att säkerställa kvaliteten på mjukvaran i våra maskiner.
   

  

 Inom R&D arbetar vi i tvärfunktionella team med såväl juniora som seniora ingenjörer inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Testa delsystems SW kopplat till Core och lågnivå
* Testa uppkopplade system och systemintegritet såsom connectivity och cyber security
* Inför releaser och formativa tester ingå i ett större testteam för att validera och verifiera system SW
* Skriva testspecifikationer/testfall samt exekvera/rapportera både för manuella och automatiska tester
* Dokumentation i våra kvalitetssystem
* Ett nära samarbete med systemarkitekt, SW-utvecklare och övrig testorganisation inom anestesi
* Delaktig i test och verifiering av framtidens generation samt den befintliga versionen av vår anestesimaskin
* Du kommer att arbeta på plats i våra nyrenoverade lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta på distans någon dag i veckan.


**Vad du har med dig**
 I den här rollen ser vi att du har följande med dig:
   

  

* Civil- eller Högskoleingenjörsexamen
* Några års erfarenhet inom manuella tester av inbyggda system.
* Goda kunskaper i något av språken eller ramverken kring C++/Python/Squish
* Erfarenhet av att testa inbyggda system
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Linux och ett intresse för CI/CD.
* Erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och test.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom medicinteknik.
* Erfarenhet av mätteknik kopplat till flöde, tryck, spänning etc.


 Förutom tekniska färdigheter värderar vi din personlighet högt. Som person tror vi att du är driven, nyfiken, engagerad samt positiv till nya idéer och arbetssätt Du är självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ. Du är van och trivs med att kommunicera med olika intressenter i en organisation tillika att samarbeta både i och utanför teamet. Vi tror att du har lätt för att lära dig nya tekniska områden och att du är bekväm i att fatta tekniska beslut.
   

  

 På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och sätter stort värde på kvalitet och samarbete. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra för att vi som team och bolag ska kunna fortsatta utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner och gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt detta för att säkerställa att vi stöder ditt välbefinnande och dina mål.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett jobb i en säker och informell arbetsmiljö, där vi uppskattar en positiv inställning och ett nära teamsamarbete. Vi har en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare, samt mellan teamen. Vi fokuserar på att utveckla människor och tillsammans skapar vi en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling när du börjar din karriär hos oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Katarina Dahlén på katarina.dahlen@getinge.com eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand på sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vi hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade medicintekniska företag.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us - and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a Fullstack Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the Growth / Monetization product team. Your role will be to experiment, design, and collaborate on building software systems and features that directly drive and optimize revenue strategies, having a direct and measurable impact on the company's financial success and user experience.
 



 The Growth / Monetization product team is focused on driving revenue growth by optimizing the company's pricing, packaging, product, and feature launches. Its core mission is to develop and implement user-centered approaches that maximize revenue potential while maintaining an excellent user experience.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Influence how the team collaborates, ships code, and engages with stakeholders and dependencies, setting the foundation for our success.
* Be part of setting team-specific engineering standards, processes, and best practices from the start.
* Tackle fresh problems in a rapidly growing area, making a real impact on key business metrics like Conversion and MRR.
* Work closely with product managers, data analysts, designers, and marketing to ship high-impact changes.
* Your work will touch critical revenue-generating areas such as pricing, plans, international launches, upgrading and upselling paths.



  





**Requirements** 



* 4+ years of experience with React, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and IMS.
* 4+ years of experience with Python and/or GoLang.
* Proven experience with experimentation (A/B testing) and working with metrics to drive decisions.
* Adaptable: able to constantly learn from data, challenge the views we hold, and adjust to changing priorities and roadmaps.
* Collaborative: strong team member able to effectively work across functions, disciplines, teams, and product areas.
* Passionate about identifying challenges and building user-centric, revenue-generating solutions.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience with Next.js.
* Experience working with monetization and data-driven decision-making.



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: Project Manager
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

**Job Summary**
---------------


*Would you like to drive a mix of activities, development needs and influence our future portfolio for food processing?*

  



The Development & Quality (D&Q) department within Liquid Food Solutions (LFS) has a global role to develop new products and production concepts for the different business streams; Dairy, Beverage, Prepared food and Plant-based industry. The D&Q team, Project Management & Planning supports the business with product development, business transformation, and other needs for the business streams and other key stakeholders.

  



We are now looking for a **Project Manager** to support and drive development projects and activities for LFS. In this role, you’ll also act as a Scrum Master, facilitating agile events and helping the team stay focused and organized. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders across our global organization.

  



The position offers a wide internal and external network in a global organisation. You will work with the newest food processing technologies, delivering new innovations and improvements, in the field of process optimization, sustainability and product quality.

  




This is a permanent position located in Lund, Sweden. Travel may occur but is limited.

**What you will do**
--------------------


* Take the role of Scrum Master for one or several development teams
* Facilitate various agile events, such as stand-ups, sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives, helping the team follow Agile principles and continuously improve.
* Depending on need, manage various development projects and activities according to a prioritized backlog
* Collaborate with Product Management, and other stakeholders, to deliver solutions aligned with defined business objectives
* Actively contribute to the LFS Agile methodology, fostering continuous improvements and team collaboration.
**We believe you have**
-----------------------



A passion about people and a strong drive for results with solid stakeholder management skills. This will enable you to navigate in a matrix organisation. We also see that you can easily interact with people at different levels and build trust. You are persistent, structured, have strong analytical and planning skills and are self-motivated.

  



You have at least **5 years within Project Management / Product Owner / Scrum Master** or equivalent experience from technology or product development, preferably within the food processing industry or similar. You are highly skilled in applied Agile principles and Scrum methodology, with solid experience from a role as Scrum Master. It is also a strong merit if you hold a BSc in Engineering, are PMI certified and have experience from waterfall projects. You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.

**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  


**Apply Now**



If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.


*To find out more about how it is to work at Tetra Pak in Lund, take a look at the following website* *We are Tetra Pak Lund*

  

This job posting expires on 2025.10.31.



To know more about the position contact hiring manager Mikael Lövquist at +46 733 36 4713



Questions about your application contact senior recruiter Martin Fosser at +46 46 36 4674



For trade union information contact Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533 and Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*
company_description: At Tetra Pak we like a good challenge, and our promise is to make food safe and available everywhere.

title: Customer Care Coordinator
description:
***Karo Healthcare***
*, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*




 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Customer Care Coordinator** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

**Be at the heart of our customer operations, in a hands-on role with real impact.**
 You'll join an agile, international company in growth mode—where your work shapes the daily experience of our customers and retail partners across the Nordics. Expect collaboration across borders, exposure to multiple business functions, and the chance to grow your career in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment.
   




**What you'll be doing**
* Be the go-to contact for our pharmacy and retail customers in the Nordics—resolving order-related questions and ensuring timely communication.
* Monitor orders and coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth, on-time deliveries.
* Send order confirmations and manage inquiries with precision and speed.
* Proactively communicate stock availability, delivery delays, and provide solutions.
* Work closely with supply chain, logistics, and commercial teams to remove roadblocks and boost customer satisfaction.
* Handle complex inquiries and escalations with a structured, customer-first approach.
* Log and follow up on customer cases, supporting ongoing improvement efforts.
* Support customer-specific processes including campaigns, promotional deliveries, and tailored reporting.
* Share customer insights internally to help improve product availability and service levels
  

  


**Requirements**
**Requirements**
* 2-3 years of experience in customer service, order management, or supply chain—ideally from a fast-moving, product-driven environment.
* Comfortable navigating ERP systems (IFS, SAP, Navision, or similar).
* Fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 .
* Confident using
 **Excel and Outlook** 
 as daily tools.
* Previous experience in
 **FMCG, healthcare, or pharma** 
 is a strong plus.
* You're structured, solutions-focused, and enjoy working with multiple stakeholders to deliver results.
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule, hybrid model with the primary work place in the office, and life-work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: E-commerce & Operations Manager
description:
**About Conscious Breathing** 
  
 



 Conscious Breathing helps people improve health, performance, and peace of mind through better breathing habits. Founded by Anders Olsson, the company combines over 15 years of research, education, and product innovation to make people lead better lives by making breathing practices and CO2 Therapy accessible to everyone. 
 



  





 Our products like the
 **Relaxator** 
 ,
 **Sleep Tape** 
 , and
 **Cardihaler** 
 are used by thousands of people, coaches, and therapists worldwide. Through education, workshops, and partnerships with researchers and clinics, we’re pioneering a new understanding of how carbon dioxide and functional breathing support health and recovery. 
 



  





 We’re a small, dedicated team working with global partners to bring simple but powerful breathing tools to the world. 
 



  





**The Role** 
  
 



 We’re looking for a hands-on
 **E-commerce & Operations Manager** 
 to lead the day-to-day running of our business, from logistics and marketing coordination to partner communication and team management. 
 



  





 You’ll be the connective tissue of the company: ensuring that products are in stock, campaigns go out on time, our online store runs smoothly, and that our remote team and collaborators stay aligned and productive. This role is perfect for someone early in their career who’s organized, proactive, and passionate about wellness, e-commerce, and getting things done. 
 



  





 This person will also be responsible for the Stockholm office. This includes being responsible for making sure all shipments to and from the office is received and sent on time.
 



  
 



**Key Responsibilities** 
  
 



  





***1. Operations & Supply Chain***





  




* Oversee inventory levels across global warehouses (EU, US, etc.)
* Coordinate with suppliers and logistics partners to manage production, purchasing, and deliveries
* Ensure smooth flow of orders, invoices, and shipments
* Manage SKU updates, product data, and pricing consistency in Shopify
* Be responsible for shipments to and from the Stockholm Office.



  





***2. E-commerce & Marketing Coordination***





  




* Oversee day-to-day performance of the Shopify store
* Coordinate product launches, promotions, and website updates
* Support email campaigns, newsletters, and social media content (with designers, VAs, and partners)
* Monitor sales, web analytics, and marketing metrics; suggest improvements



  





***3. Communication & Partner Management***





  




* Act as the first point of contact for resellers, distributors, and partners
* Support onboarding and updates for affiliates and wholesale accounts
* Maintain clear internal communication between founders, partners, and the team



  





***4. Team Coordination & Process Management***





  




* Lead and coordinate a small remote team (currently 4-5 freelancers)
* Manage weekly task lists, follow-ups, and timelines
* Improve and document workflows for repeatable tasks (Shopify, Fortnox, emails, etc.)



  
 



  





**Who You Are** 
  
 



  




* 1–3 years of experience in e-commerce, marketing, or operations
* Comfortable managing multiple moving parts and keeping people aligned
* Detail-oriented, organized, and proactive in solving problems
* Curious and adaptable — you like understanding how things work and making them better
* Confident in tools like Shopify, Klaviyo (or similar), Microsoft Office products, and Slack
* Comfortable managing a small remote team and communicating clearly in English and Swedish



  





**Nice to Have** 
  
 



  




* Experience with health, wellness, or consumer products
* Basic understanding of marketing tools (Meta Ads, Google Analytics, etc.)
* B2B/Wholesale Experience
* Interest in conscious living, breathing, or human performance
* It’s a big plus if you speak German as we have a lot of business in the DACH-region.



  





**What We Offer** 
  
 



  




* A meaningful role in a mission-driven company with a strong global brand
* The chance to work closely with founders and shape the future of the company
* A small, collaborative team with room for initiative and growth
* Flexible hours and hybrid setup

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Standardize & Scale: Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* Tackle Tech Debt: Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* Create Real Value: Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* Lead & Collaborate: Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Language Expertise: At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* Adaptability: An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* Product Mindset: Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* Problem-Solver: A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.


 Bonus Skills
   

  

* B2B & B2C Background: Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* Scaling Know-How: Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* Payments Experience: A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.


 Why Work with Us?
   

  

 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
   

  

 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
   

  

 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
   

  

 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Sales Manager (New Business) - Nordics (WorkForce Software)
description:
***WorkForce Software, an ADP company, is hiring a Sales Manager***




***Applications for this role will be accepted until 24/10/25***




  





**JOB PURPOSE:** 




 With full scope to sell across ADP's Payroll and HR solutions (including WorkForce Software), this role also provides the infrastructure, presence and brand for sales leaders to orchestrate true, global conversations with organisations. You will work as part of the leadership team and with your sales team to define individual territory plans, focusing on new prospects in the Nordics. You inherit an established, but growing sales team. The types of deals that you will be coaching the team to navigate will be both mid-market and Enterprise. This brings huge variety; it could be a 3-5 month process with 3/4 stakeholders, at €100,000 in year 1 revenue, to a multi country offering that is €500,000 - €1m in year 1 revenue at takes 12 months plus.
 



 With a world class induction programme, a leadership team offering best-in-breed expertise built from within ADP and the wider industry, and over 75 years of heritage and capability, the role offers the perfect platform for sales leaders and people, to succeed and develop.
 



  





**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at
 **ADP Awards and Recognition.** 




  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITES** 



* Responsible for the overall management, performance and development of the Nordics sales team in line with agreed sales strategy and overall business plan.
* Responsible for development and maintenance of comprehensive plan for team sales activity including pipeline and productivity. Will also manage both quota and non-commercial objectives for all individuals/team.
* Responsible for the management of all active sales processes within the team, ensuring co-ordination of company resource in an optimal and effective manner in support of these processes.



  





**KEY TASKS:** 



* To manage the performance of the sales team on a daily basis, co-ordinating resource, monitoring activity, and where necessary initiating corrective action to ensure sustainable delivery of results.
* To manage sales opportunities through direct reports
* To liaise closely with the VP Sales, other sales leaders and the operations / enablement team in pursuance of a consistent approach to sales/product/commercial strategy.
* Will submit the relevant management reports in a timely manner including up to date forecasting information.



  





**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:** 



* Will work under own initiative for day-to-day workload in line with overall strategy and guidelines.
* Will work through direct reports for specific requirements.
* Will be expected to influence members of staff where no direct line authority is in place.
* Responsible for the direction of the sales team with regard to training, compensation, motivation, development and resourcing.
* Will be expected to play a key role in the sales management team.



  





**SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:** 



* Will have the ability to anticipate, identify and analyse problems and opportunities, establish priorities and efficiently allocate and utilise resource.
* Will have acquired an in-depth knowledge of commercial/sales issues preferably within a payroll/HR software or service environment.
* Must be able to delegate and co-ordinate workloads to achieve overall objectives within specified time and budget.
* Will be able to review and measure progress against specific criteria and take necessary corrective action where appropriate.
* Must demonstrate sufficient flexibility to be able to adapt and respond to the meet the needs of shifting goals.
* Must be able to demonstrate excellent communication skills, personal integrity and a positive attitude in all dealings with colleagues/clients.



  





**EXPERIENCE NEEDED:** 



* Experience managing a remote field-based sales team
* Experience leading new business teams with a target focus of selling to Mid Market/Enterprise level customers
* Evidence of coaching sales team to perform using a structured sales process and methodologies
* SaaS / HCM / Tech solution sales experience of 5+ years
* Examples of coaching top sales performers to achieve target, and achieve deals in the region of €100k + ARR
* Based in / close to Stockholm with full right to work and driving licence.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Highly competitive salary and compensation plan
* An on-going, individualised, world class induction programme - offering both local and international training and development
* Realistic targets + valuable offerings = real earnings. We like to see our associates overachieving, and celebrate this regularly with early starts, quarterly and annual awards, clubs and trips. Recent ones include a 5-star stay in Buenos Aires and a luxury cruise around Greece!
* Excellent support teams to help you get there!
* A sales team and presence in Stockholm and the Nordics – you are not alone!
* Flexible benefits program



  





  





  





 Sales Manager, Sales Leader, New Business Sales, Sales Management, Software as a Service, SaaS, Human Resources, HR, Human Capital Management, HCM, Cloud Software

title: nätverkssäkerhetsingenjör
description:
Om Integrity360
   

  

 Integrity360 är den största oberoende cybersäkerhetsleverantören i Storbritannien och Irland, med Security Operations Centers i Dublin och Sofia, och över 310 anställda, varav mer än 80% är tekniska. Vi hjälper våra kunder att proaktivt identifiera, skydda, upptäcka och reagera på hot mot den ständigt föränderliga hotlandskapet. Vår säkerhetsförsta strategi positionerar säkerhet som en möjliggörare och ger våra kunder möjlighet att bedriva sin verksamhet säkert.
   

  

 Du kommer att ansluta till Integrity360 vid en mycket spännande tidpunkt. I juni 2021 fick företaget en strategisk investering från August Equity (ett av Storbritanniens mest framgångsrika private equity-företag inom medelstora marknader). Vår avsikt är att växa Integrity360 till den ledande leverantören av cybertjänster och lösningar i Europa. Marknaden för cybersäkerhetstjänster har aldrig varit starkare och växer i ett aggressivt tempo.
   

  

 Integrity360 är en av de mest respekterade och etablerade tjänsteleverantörerna i branschen och är väl positionerat för att uppnå en marknadsledande position de kommande åren. Vi tror att vi har betydande möjligheter till tillväxt, särskilt under de närmaste 36 månaderna. Med rätt energi, ihärdighet och skicklighet är din möjlighet till personlig framgång och bidrag till våra övergripande mål betydande.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Vi söker en nätverkssäkerhetsingenjör med fokus på nätverkssäkerhet. Du blir en del av vårt konsultteam och hjälper våra kunder att lösa tekniska problem, förebygga hot och förbättra sin IT-säkerhet.
   

  

**Du Kommer Bl a Arbeta Med**
* Ge teknisk rådgivning kring säkerhetsprodukter, särskilt Fortinet
* Lösa säkerhetsincidenter och kommunicera direkt med våra kunder
* Arbeta nära andra säkerhetstekniker i teamet
* Delta i projekt och förändringsarbete hos våra kunder


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har** 
  

  

* Minst 3-5 års erfarenhet som nätverkssäkerhetsingenjör, med särskilt fokus på Fortinet.
* Djup förståelse för nätverksinfrastruktur och säkerhet – inklusive brandväggar, routrar, switchar och protokoll.
* Gärna certifiering inom något av följande:
+ Fortinet NSE 4–8
+ Checkpoint
+ Cisco

* Högskoleexamen inom datavetenskap är meriterande men inte ett krav.


 Meriterande kunskaper
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av eller intresse för följande:
   

  

* Fortinet-teknologier (brandväggar, VPN, IPS)
* Andra brandväggsprodukter (t.ex. Checkpoint)
* UTM, sandboxing och applikationskontroll (FortiGate, CheckPoint)
* Routing och switching,
* Multifaktorautentisering
* Web Application Firewalls
* VPN-lösningar
* Virtualisering och molnplattformar (AWS, Azure)
* Scripting/programmering (t.ex. bash, Python)
* OT kunskap


 Vill du vara med på vår resa och bidra till Europas ledande cybersäkerhetsleverantör?

title: Commercial Systems Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 You deliver detailed continuous business and customer analysis and insight with a focus on driving best practice through simplification, efficiency, consistency by aligning common outputs across accounts.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Provide support and training to enable effective use of sales systems.
* Maintain and optimize systems for sales (including functionalities for customer management, tour planning, promotion planning, listing maintenance, shelf audit and reporting).
* Provide support to users with specific technical problems in cooperation with IT service providers.
* Drive continuous improvement of existing software and automation of new processes.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* Post-secondary education at College or University or equivalent experience, in a related subject
* Relevant experience in IT and sales
* Knowledge of sales processes and systems
* Facilitation skills to demonstrate use and functionality of sales systems
* Problem-solving skills
* Excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially in Excel.
* Experience developing reports in Power BI.
* If you have experience from the Retail Business, particularly FMCG (Fast moving consumer goods), it would be an advantage
* Very good administrative ability, attention to detail and enjoy working with numbers
* You organise your work effectively, and see possibilities to optimize
* You demonstrate independence, engagement and flexibility in your work, and are adaptable to changing priorities and demands.
* Contribute effectively as a team member and foster a positive team environment.
* You are dedicated to providing exceptional service and approach challenges with a positive attitude.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.


**More About This Role**
**What you need to know about this position:**
 In this role you will be part of the team that provides analyses, reports, developments, training and system support to the Swedish Sales Organization. You will be a key player in maintaining and developing Power BI reports for the Swedish Sales Team, and be a key part in projects regarding Sales system developments.
   

  

 Apply today to become part of a team which is passionate about Systems, Sales and working with People. Characterized by a collaborative working environment. You will take part in modernizing and streamlining our systems and see clear results of your work throughout the business.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

title: Power System Engineer for Power Consulting Sweden
description:
**The Opportunity**
 Seize this opportunity to take on a highly visible position in a global organization. As a Power System Engineer you will belong to Power Consulting, a department within Hitachi Energy working with both internal and external clients in the energy sector. You will be part of a renowned global team of power system and energy consultants. In the role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the green transition and create a more sustainable energy future for all.
   

  

 So, if you want to take the next step in your career, and contribute to develop a stronger, smarter, and greener energy system – Join us now! We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join it!
   

  

**How You’ll Make An Impact**
* In this exciting role, you will get the opportunity to take part in major assignments related to the green energy transition together with our consultants and experts from local as well as international Power Consulting offices.
* The assignments for the role are mainly system studies within the area of HVDC, FACTS, renewable energy integration, green hydrogen and power systems in general.
* Cooperation and work in teams with leading specialists together with Hitachi Energy well-defined career path ensures exciting and motivating career with fast development along own interests and personality traits.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.


**Your background**
* You hold a Master’s degree in electrical engineering, electrical power systems or similar.
* You have a great interest and preferably a couple of years of experience in the consulting and energy sector.
* Knowledge in power systems analysis and in software simulation tools such as PSS/E, PSCAD and/or DIgSILENT PowerFactory.
* Programming skill in Python, C++, etc. is a merit.
* You have an analytical mindset, you are independent, self-going and take your own initiatives to solve problems.
* As a person, you are collaborative and communicative.
* It is necessary to be fluent in English. Swedish is meritorious.


**What We Offer**
* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role


**More About Us**
 The position is based in Gothenburg or Stockholm (Solna).
   

  

 We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!
   

  

 Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!
   

  

 Recruiting Manager, Joachim Andersson, joachim.x.andersson@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner, Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com.
   

  

 Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader in electrification, powering a sustainable energy future through innovative power grid technologies with digital at the core. Over three billion people depend on our technologies to power their daily lives.
   

  

 With over a century in pioneering mission-critical technologies like high-voltage, transformers, automation, and power electronics, we are addressing the most urgent energy challenge of our time – balancing soaring electricity demand, while decarbonizing the power system.
   

  

 Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ over 50,000 people in 60 countries and generate revenues of around $16 billion USD. We welcome you to apply today.

title: QA-ingenjör
description:
Nu söker vi en ny kollega till vår avdelning som arbetar med IT-förvaltning. Teamet består idag av åtta personer och tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor på Skeppsbron i Stockholm.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som QA-ingenjör blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att säkerställa kvaliteten på våra programvaruprodukter och IT-system. Rollen kombinerar strategiskt ansvar med praktiskt arbete, där du får möjlighet att driva utvecklingen av våra kvalitetssäkringsprocesser och samtidigt vara nära den dagliga testningen. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa kvalitet och stabilitet i våra försäkringstjänster, med särskilt fokus på automatisering, API-testning och testdatahantering.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Utveckla automatiserade tester i Java
* Schemalägga och underhålla dagliga end-to-end regressionstester
* Övervaka testresultat och rapportera avvikelser
* Skapa syntetiskt testdata baserad på försäkringsspecifika krav
* Utveckla och implementera testprocesser, kvalitetssäkringsstrategier och rutiner för testdata
* Samarbeta med utveckling, produktägare och verksamhet för att identifiera behov, planera testning och säkra dokumentation
* Delta både operativt i testning (funktionell, regression, integration, prestanda m.m.) och driva förbättringar av metoder, verktyg och ramverk
* Fungera som mentor och utbildare för kollegor samt bidra till kunskapsdelning och omvärldsbevakning inom QA


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi vill att du har en examen inom data/systemutvecklingsområdet eller arbetslivserfarenheter och kunskaper som motsvarar detta. Vi vill också att du har erfarenhet och intresse av att planera, leda och hantera testaktiviteter samt flerårig erfarenhet med felrapportering, versionskontroll och konfigurationshantering, tillsammans med olika testmetoder (funktionell, systemintegration, UAT, prestanda).
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du har tekniska kunskaper som gör dig självgående i testarbetet och dina kunskaper bör finnas bland annat inom Java, REST API:er, TIA-systemet, Spring Boot, Testautomatisering och regressionstester samt Jira. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från försäkring eller bank, innehar ISTQB-certifiering samt har en teknisk bakgrund med förmåga att skriva egna testautomationsskript från grunden.
   

  

**Vem du är**
* Har förmåga att prioritera och arbeta självständigt, samtidigt som du är en stark lagspelare med passion för kvalitet
* Besitter stark problemlösningsförmåga och ett naturligt ägarskap i ditt arbete
* Är flexibel och har lätt att anpassa dig till nya och utmanande situationer
* Pedagogisk och lyhörd i samarbeten
* Trivs i ett agilt team och kommunicerar tydligt med både tekniska och icke-tekniska kollegor


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du växa. Vi erbjuder en kultur präglad av samarbete, utveckling och engagemang. Här får du möjlighet att påverka, ta ansvar och bidra. Vi tror på en inkluderande och flexibel arbetsmiljö där du kan vara dig själv. Här vågar vi tänka nytt och jobbar tillsammans för att göra skillnad – för våra kunder, varandra och framtidens försäkringslösningar.
   

  

**Välkommen in med din ansökan!**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Roger Centervall 072-099 67 40, Chef IT-förvaltning. Facklig representant för Forena är Sammy Bergman, telefon 08-5180 38 27.
   

  

 Eftersom vi jobbar med ett löpande urval ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast den 7 november. För att säkerställa en trygg arbetsmiljö genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidaten i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Om Dina Försäkringar**
 Dina Försäkringar är en grupp lokalt förankrade, kundägda försäkringsbolag med 250 års historia. Hos oss är beslutsvägarna korta, utvecklingstakten hög och möjligheterna att påverka stora. Vår vision är att ge hela Sverige trygghet i vardagen och mod att investera i en hållbar framtid. Det gör vi genom att förstå kundernas vardag, tänka nytt, vara nära och finnas till för våra kunder när de behöver oss. Och det uppskattas. För femte året i rad har vi branschens nöjdaste privatkunder och är tillbaka i topp även bland företagskunderna enligt Svenskt Kvalitetsindex. Och vår Mäklardisk har fått utmärkelser för bland annat bästa service. Vårt engagemang i lokalsamhället är stort och vi stöttar föreningar, kulturevenemang och skadeförebyggande insatser över hela landet.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/65 | Publicerat: 2025-10-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-07

title: People Systems Partner
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 





 At Trustly, we're building a smarter, faster, and more secure financial future by revolutionizing the world of payments. As a global leader in Open Banking Payments, we are establishing Pay by Bank as the new standard at checkout, providing unparalleled freedom, speed, and ease to millions of consumers and merchants worldwide.
 




  






 Our Ambition: To build the world’s most disruptive payment network and redefine what the payment experience should feel like.
 




  






 Trustly is a global team of innovators, collaborators, and doers.  If you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and high-growth environment, join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the way the world pays.
 




  





**About the team
 
 Our People team blends a multitude of skills within organisational development, strategic empowerment of our leaders, People operations, internal communication & culture, employee branding, people enablement/engagement initiatives and total rewards. The team’s vision is to unite and empower passionate people and to bring inspiration and energy into everyday work life, while our mission is to form a resilient and agile organization. 
 



  





**About the role
 
 Are you passionate about improving the employee experience through smart systems, data, and processes? We're looking for a People Systems Partner to join our growing People team. In this role, you'll be the critical link between People operations, technology, and data – ensuring our systems run smoothly and support the full employee lifecycle. You’ll work cross-functionally with People, IT, and business leaders to optimize our people platforms, enhance reporting capabilities, and support key projects like system implementations, process automation, and compliance.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Act as the subject matter expert for all HR systems
* Drive system improvements, integrations, and automations to improve efficiency and accuracy
* Partner with HR, Payroll, and IT teams to manage system configurations, permissions, and workflows
* Support the implementation and roll-out of new tools or system modules
* Create and maintain reports and dashboards to support People analytics and compliance
* Train People team members and managers on system usage and best practices
* Ensure data integrity and support audits through regular system maintenance and checks
* Lead or support change management and communication efforts related to systems and processes



  




**Who you are** 
* Experience with system implementations or upgrades
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Detail-oriented, proactive, and eager to drive continuous improvement
* Tech-savvy, adaptable, and passionate about people and culture
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Comfortable managing system configuration and data






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**

 (varies by location)
 




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.******

title: Testingenjör inbyggda system
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ge dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 På Getinge Critical Care i Solna utvecklas och tillverkas ventilatorer och anestesimaskiner till sjukvården. Vi söker nu en testare till ett av våra R&D team inom anestesi.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av 8 personer och ansvarar för Core SW, systemarkitektur, cyber security samt connectivity i våra anestesimaskiner. Din roll i detta team och inom anestesi är att testa Core SW tillsammans med lågnivå SW för att säkerställa kvaliteten på mjukvaran i våra maskiner.
   

  

 Inom R&D arbetar vi i tvärfunktionella team med såväl juniora som seniora ingenjörer inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Testa delsystems SW kopplat till Core och lågnivå
* Testa uppkopplade system och systemintegritet såsom connectivity och cyber security
* Inför releaser och formativa tester ingå i ett större testteam för att validera och verifiera system SW
* Skriva testspecifikationer/testfall samt exekvera/rapportera både för manuella och automatiska tester
* Dokumentation i våra kvalitetssystem
* Ett nära samarbete med systemarkitekt, SW-utvecklare och övrig testorganisation inom anestesi
* Delaktig i test och verifiering av framtidens generation samt den befintliga versionen av vår anestesimaskin
* Du kommer att arbeta på plats i våra nyrenoverade lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta på distans någon dag i veckan.


**Vad du har med dig**
 I den här rollen ser vi att du har följande med dig:
   

  

* Civil- eller Högskoleingenjörsexamen
* Några års erfarenhet inom manuella tester av inbyggda system.
* Goda kunskaper i något av språken eller ramverken kring C++/Python/Squish
* Erfarenhet av att testa inbyggda system
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Linux och ett intresse för CI/CD.
* Erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och test.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom medicinteknik.
* Erfarenhet av mätteknik kopplat till flöde, tryck, spänning etc.


 Förutom tekniska färdigheter värderar vi din personlighet högt. Som person tror vi att du är driven, nyfiken, engagerad samt positiv till nya idéer och arbetssätt Du är självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ. Du är van och trivs med att kommunicera med olika intressenter i en organisation tillika att samarbeta både i och utanför teamet. Vi tror att du har lätt för att lära dig nya tekniska områden och att du är bekväm i att fatta tekniska beslut.
   

  

 På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och sätter stort värde på kvalitet och samarbete. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra för att vi som team och bolag ska kunna fortsatta utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner och gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt detta för att säkerställa att vi stöder ditt välbefinnande och dina mål.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett jobb i en säker och informell arbetsmiljö, där vi uppskattar en positiv inställning och ett nära teamsamarbete. Vi har en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare, samt mellan teamen. Vi fokuserar på att utveckla människor och tillsammans skapar vi en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling när du börjar din karriär hos oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Katarina Dahlén på katarina.dahlen@getinge.com eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand på sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vi hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade medicintekniska företag.
